Description: Base and flaring foot sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed; on floor of bowl, cross in added white and four dots in added red; exterior: glazed (very worn and fired red in places); traces of three white bands at bottom of foot. Underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see the chalice from Pitane, now in the Istanbul Museum (Lemos 1991, no. 2267, pl. 87, no. 674).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0625) (phase 2)
